IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PRESERVE THE 1,120 ACRE HISTORIC PROPERTY, MAINTAIN AND PRESERVE THE HERMITAGE MANSION AND 27 OTHER STRUCTURES AND COLLECTIONS INCLUDING REPAIRS OF MANSION WINDOWS AND UPGRADE OF SPRINKLER, FIRE, AND SECURITY ALARM SYSTEMS, PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS TO THE PUBLIC INCLUDING JR. DOCENT PROGRAM, HANDS-ON HISTORY, THE RACHEL VIRTUAL CLASS, HERMITAGE HOME SCHOOL DAYS, THE SCOUT SCAVENGER HUNT & THE DUEL, MAKE THE SITE AVAILABLE TO 220,000+/- GUESTS ANNUALLY AND HOST EVENTS, PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES THAT INSPIRE A LOVE OF AMERICAN HISTORY INCLUDING BLACK HISTORY MONTH AND VETERAN'S DAY PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE ANDREW JACKSON FOUNDATION, A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION FOUNDED IN 1889, IS TO PRESERVE THE HOME OF ANDREW JACKSON AND TO SERVE AS A LEARNING RESOURCE FOR THE DIVERSE PUBLIC. WE WILL ENGAGE THE PUBLIC THROUGH PRESERVATION, EXHIBITIONS, EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND PUBLICATIONS TO INCREASE THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE COMPLEX ISSUES OF ANDREW JACKSON AND HIS TIMES, TO DISCUSS THEIR RELATIONSHIP TO ISSUES AND EVENTS OF TODAY, AND TO INSPIRE CULTURAL CITIZENSHIP.
IRS990.Desc: THE HERMITAGE IS THE HOME AND FARM OF PRESIDENT ANDREW JACKSON, 7TH PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES AND HERO OF THE BATTLE OF NEW ORLEANS DURING THE WAR OF 1812. THE 1,120-ACRE NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK SITE INCLUDES JACKSON'S ENTIRE TENNESSEE ANTEBELLUM COTTON PLANTATION AS WELL AS NUMEROUS ARCHITECTURAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL TREASURES. THE HERMITAGE WELCOMED OVER 228,000 GUESTS TO THE PROPERTY DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.A NEW TICKET OFFICE WAS DESIGNED AND BUILT AND CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE WAS IMPLEMENTED TO PROVIDE EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE TO GUESTS AND PROVIDE LARGER MARKETING OPPORTUNITIES FOR REPEAT VISITORS. A NEW STATE OF THE ART FIRE SUPPRESSION SYSTEM WAS INSTALLED IN HERMITAGE MANSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VALUES ATTRIBUTABLE TO HISTORIC SITES (TRANSFERRED TO THE ASSOCIATION BY THE STATE OF TENNESSEE) ARE NOT RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS SINCE THE VALUES TO SUCH HISTORICAL TREASURES ARE NOT GENERALLY MEASURABLE IN MONETARY TERMS.

THE 1,120-ACRE NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK SITE INCLUDES ANDREW JACKSON'S ENTIRE TENNESSEE ANTEBELLUM COTTON PLANTATION, AS WELL AS, NUMEROUS ARCHITECTURAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL TREASURES. THE EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE ORGANIZATION IS TO PRESERVE THIS HOME AND TO SERVE AS A LEARNING RESOURCE FOR THE DIVERSE PUBLIC.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 617,999. SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 176,238.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 617,999. SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 176,238.

FundraiserActivityInfoGrp.ActivityTxt: CONSULTS FOR SOLICITING CONTRIBUTIONS FOR NEW EXHIBIT

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE ELECTED BY THE BOARD ITSELF AT ITS ANNUAL MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO COMMITTEE HAS AUTHORITY TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CEO AND THE VP OF FINANCE; THE 990 IS ALSO MADE AVAILABLE TO THE BOARD TO REVIEW BEFORE IT IS SIGNED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NEW BOARD MEMBERS ARE TRAINED ON POLICY AND PROCEDURE WHICH CONTAINS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MARKET VALUES ARE DETERMINED WITHIN BUDGET CONSTRAINTS AND COMPARABLE POSITIONS IN THE REGION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. FINANCIAL INFORMATION IS ALSO DISCLOSED IN THE ANNUAL REPORT.
